TheColecoVisionisColecoColeco Industries'History of video game consoles (second generation)second-generationhome video game consolehome video-game consolewhich was released in August 1982. The ColecoVision offered near-arcade gamearcade-qualitygraphics and gaming style along with the means to expand the system's basic hardware. Released with a catalog of 12launch titles, with an additional 10 games announced for 1982, approximately 145 titles in total were published asROM cartridgesfor the system between 1982 and 1984.CitationForsterWinnieWinnie ForsterThe encyclopedia of consoles, handhelds & home computers 1972 - 20052005GAMEPLAN3-00-015359-450River West Brands currently owns the ColecoVision brand name.cite webhttp://www.riverwestbrands.com/news/RiverWest_Underalls_Announcement.pdfPress release for River West BrandsPDF2010-12-20

In 2009,IGNnamed the ColecoVision their 12th-best video-game console out of their list of 25, citing "its incredible accuracy in bringing current-generation arcade hits home."cite webhttp://www.ign.com/top-25-consoles/12.htmlColecovision is number 12IGN2010-12-20
article.heading: History
article.paragraph: Coleco licensedNintendo'sDonkey Kong (video game)Donkey Kongas the official pack-in cartridge for all ColecoVision consoles, helping to boost the console's popularity. By Christmas of 1982, Coleco had sold more than 500,000 units,CitationBusiness WeekColeco hits with home video games311983-01-24Most of 1982's action was in the second half, when Coleco shipped 550,000 ColecoVision game machines--which sell for $169 to $189--booking orders for nearly that many more.CitationAssociated PressVideo Game Maker Says 1st-Quarter Profit More Than Tripled1983-04-20Arnold C. Greenberg, Coleco's president and chief executive, said more than 500,000 ColecoVision players were shipped during the first quarter, nearly equaling the number shipped in all of 1982.in part on the strength of its bundled game.CitationNew York TimesColeco's New Video Challenge1 (Section D)1982-11-11Potential Colecovision buyers have also apparently been attracted by Coleco's licensing agreement with Nintendo Inc., the Japanese creator of Donkey Kong, a current arcade hit, and Universal City Studios Inc. One Donkey Kong cartridge comes with each Colecovision unit.The ColecoVision's main competitor was the arguably more advanced but less commercially successfulAtari 5200.CitationChristian Science MonitorZap! Pow! Video games sparkle in holiday marketAeppelTimothy71982-12-10In recent weeks, two particularly hot-selling systems have emerged - the Atari 5200 and ColecoVision. Both are described as powerful 'third wave' machines, the Cadillacs of game systems, and priced accordingly at close to $200...[T]hey are sure to snatch most of the Christmas market.CitationNew York TimesSigh of Relief on Video GamesHarmetzAljean1 (Section D)1984-01-10As for game hardware, many experts said that Atari's...5200 or Coleco's Colecovision would corner the high end.CitationNew York TimesColeco Strong In Marketing1983-08-01Since its introduction last fall, Colecovision has sold about 1.4 million units...Of that total, about 900,000 were sold this year, compared with 800,000 units by Atari and 300,000 by Mattel.
The ColecoVision was distributed byCBS Electronicsoutside ofNorth America, and was branded theCBS ColecoVision.

Sales quickly passed 1 million in early 1983,Video Game Maker Says 1st-Quarter Profit More Than Tripled, 1983-04-20before thevideo game crash of 1983. By the beginning of 1984, quarterly sales of the ColecoVision had dramatically decreased.CitationPR NewswireColeco Industries sales report1984-04-17'First quarter sales of ColecoVision were substantial, although much less {{sic|that}} those for the year ago quarter,' Greenberg said in a prepared statement. He said the company has sold 2 million ColecoVision games since its introduction in 1982.

Over the next 18 months, the Coleco company ramped down its video game division, ultimately withdrawing from the video game market by the end of the summer of 1985.CitationNew York TimesReutersColeco Reassesses Its Video Games4 (Section D)1985-06-13Coleco Industries is assessing its continuing commitment to the video game business...Arnold C. Greenberg, the chief executive, said no timetable had been set for a decision on continuing or dropping the Colecovision products or on whether the software for the games would continue to be produced if hardware production was discontinued.CitationThe Globe and Mail (Canada)Video games Coleco may drop out1985-06-21Coleco Industries Inc. of West Hartford, Conn., is considering withdrawal from the video game business in both hardware and software.The ColecoVision was officially discontinued by October 1985.CitationNew York TimesAssociated PressColeco's Net In Sharp Rise1985-10-19Thursday, Coleco said the entire inventory of its troubled Adam personal computer has been sold, along with much of its Colecovision inventory. The company's chairman, Arnold Greenberg, said Coleco expects no more charges against earnings from the two discontinued products.Total sales of the ColecoVision are uncertain but were ultimately in excess of 2 million units, as sales had reached that number by the spring of 1984,while the console continued to sell modestly up until its discontinuation the following year.CitationNew York TimesKleinfieldN. R.Coleco Moves Out Of The Cabbage Patch4 (Section 3)1985-07-21Coleco is now debating whether to withdraw from electronics altogether. Colecovision still sells, but it is a shadow of its former self.

In 1983Spectravideoannounced the SV-603 ColecoVision Video Game Adapter for itsSV-318computer. The company stated that the $70 product allowed users to "enjoy the entire library of exciting ColecoVision video-game cartridges".cite newshttp://www.cgwmuseum.org/galleries/index.php?yearHeavy HardwareSoftlineMarch 198328 July 201446In 1986,Bit Corporationproduced a ColecoVision clone called theDina (video game console)Dina, which was sold in the United States by Telegames as theTelegames Personal Arcade.cite webhttp://classicgaming.gamespy.com/View.php?viewColecoVision - 1982-1984 - Classic GamingClassicgaming.gamespy.com2010-12-20
article.heading: Hardware
article.paragraph: File:ColecoVision-Controller-FR.jpgthumbleftThe ColecoVision's controller featured a numberpad that could be fitted with overlays.The main console unit consists of a 1482 inch rectangular plastic case that houses the motherboard, with a cartridge slot on the right side and connectors for the externalpower supplyandRF connectorRF jackat the rear. Thegame controllercontrollersconnect into plugs in a recessed area on the top of the unit.

The design of the controllers is similar to that ofMattel'sIntellivisionthe controller is rectangular and consists of a numeric keypad and a set of side buttons. In place of the circular control disc below the keypad, the Coleco controller has a short, 1.5-inchjoystick. The keypad is designed to accept a thin plastic overlay that maps the keys for a particular game. Each ColecoVision console shipped with two controllers.

All first-party cartridges and most third-party software titles feature a 12-second pause before presenting the game select screen.cite newshttp://www.archive.org/stream/electronic-games-magazine-1983-06/Electronic_Games_Issue_16_Vol_02_04_1983_Jun#page/n109/mode/2upQ&AElectronic GamesJune 19837 January 2015The Game Doctor112This delay results from an intentional loop in the console'sBIOSto enable on-screen display of the ColecoVision brand. Companies likeParker Brothers,Activision, andMicro Funbypassed this loop, which necessitated embedding portions of the BIOS outside the delay loop, further reducing storage available to actual game programming.

article.heading: Expansion Modules and accessories
article.paragraph: From its introduction, Coleco touted the ColecoVision's hardware expandability by highlighting theExpansion Module Interfaceon the front of the unit. These hardware expansion modules and accessories were sold separately.
article.heading: Released

link.part: The Expansion Module #1 allowed the ColecoVision to play any game from theAtari 2600.

list.listitem: ShanzhaiExpansion Module #1makes the ColecoVision compatible with the industry-leadingAtari 2600, with some exceptions.cite newshttp://www.archive.org/stream/electronic-games-magazine-1983-06/Electronic_Games_Issue_16_Vol_02_04_1983_Jun#page/n109/mode/2upQ&AElectronic GamesJune 19837 January 2015The Game Doctor112Functionally, this gave the ColecoVision the largest software library of any console of its day. The expansion module prompted legal action from Atari, but Atari was unable to stop sales of the module because the 2600 could be reproduced with off the shelf parts. Coleco also designed and sold theColeco GeminiGemini game system, which was a clone of the 2600, but with combined joystick/paddle controllers.

Expansion Module #2is a driving controller (steering wheel/ gas pedal) that came packaged with a port of the arcade gameTurbo (video game)Turbo. The gas pedal is merely a simple on/off switch, so many games used the second ColecoVision controller as a gear shift for more precise speed control.cite webhttp://www.the-liberator.net/site-files/retro-games/hardware/ColecoVision/colecovision-expansion-moduel-no-2-driving-controller.htmColeco ColecoVision Expansion Module No. 2 Driving Controller DisassembledThe-liberator.net2014-05-27Although Coleco called the driving controller an expansion module, it actually plugs into the controller port, not theExpansion Module Interface.http://www.colecovisionzone.com/photos/accessory/module2%20manual.pdfThe driving controller is also compatible with the gamesDestructor,Bump n Jump, andDukes Of Hazzard.
Expansion Module #3converts the ColecoVision into a full-fledged computer known as theColeco AdamAdam, complete with keyboard, digital data pack (DDP) cassette drives and printer.

TheRoller Controlleris atrackballthat came packaged with a port of the arcade gameSlither (video game)Slither, aCentipede (arcade game)Centipedeclone.cite newshttp://www.archive.org/stream/electronic-games-magazine-1983-06/Electronic_Games_Issue_16_Vol_02_04_1983_Jun#page/n23/mode/2upController Update: Probing the World of the ExoticElectronic GamesJune 19836 January 201524â€“28cite AV media2008Classic Game Room reviews COLECOVISION ROLLER CONTROLLERYouTubehttp://www.youtube.com/watch?vApril 2, 2014YouTube4:45Lord KarnageThe roller controller uses a special power connector which is not compatible with Expansion Module #3 (the Adam computer). Coleco mailed an adapter to owners of both units who complained.http://www.colecovisionzone.com/photos/accessory/roller%20manual.pdfThe roller controller is also compatible with the gamesVictory,Omega Race, andWargames (game)Wargames, and was also compatible with Atarisoft's port ofCentipede, which used a trackball for arcade play.

TheSuper Action Controller Setis a set of two joysticks (each resembling a boxing glove) that came packaged with the gameSuper Action Baseball. Each joystick has four action buttons, a 12-button numeric keypad, and a "speed roller".http://www.colecovisionzone.com/photos/accessory/superaction%20manual.pdfThe Super Action Controllers are also compatible with the gamesSuper Action Football,RockySuper Action Boxing, and a port of the arcade gameFront Line (arcade game)Front Line.
